CMVP (NIST/CCCS) oversees labs testing security levels 1-4 (Level 3/4: tamper-resistant for HSMs, side-channel protection). Key differences: 140-3 (current) aligns with ISO/IEC 19790:2012 (modular, updated algos, better interfaces); 140-2 sunsetting. Validation: Design > Accredited lab tests (physical, crypto, env.) > CMVP cert. HSM reqs: Tamper detection, zeroization, roles. Best practices: Migrate to 140-3 for finance/cloud KMI. Refs: NIST FIPS 140-3 (SP 800-140 series), CMVP.nist.gov. **Pedagogy Integration:** - Learning Objectives: [Insert full list above]. - Scaffolding: Build flashcards progressively across 4 layers [Insert full scaffolding]. - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving [Insert full active learning]. - Prior Knowledge: Link to Cryptography basics, HSM fundamentals. **Generate 25 high-quality flashcards using this exact schema:** {flashcard_schema structure above}. Balance: 30% Layer 1-2 (remember/understand), 40% Layer 3 (apply/analyze), 30% Layer 4 (evaluate/create). Ensure distractors are realistic (e.g., 140-2 vs 140-3 mix-ups). Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['d1','d2','d3'], 'references': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...', 'active_tie': '...'}}, ...].
